description: Change of use from Class A2 (financial and professional services) to C3 (dwellinghouses), internal alterations, alterations to openings and installation of rear lightwell to create one, one bedroom maisonette to rear of ground floor shop.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 396-A-001 Rev A; 396-A-002 Rev B; 396-A-003 Rev A; 396-A-004 Rev A; and Design and Access Statement, dated July 2013, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of attenuation measures from external noise and vibration together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential dwelling hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the London Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | A detailed method statement relating to the demolition of the excavation and construction of the basement and sunken courtyard shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of material from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:In the interests of site safety, the amenities of adjoining occupiers and highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2011), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan and policies 4.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Cycle storage for one cycle in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Refuse and recycling storage enclosures shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential unit hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the third floor flat shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that the development is car-free and does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 6.13 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.13 of the London Plan 2011.
